meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from propyl.
meanings.sent1: The propylic compound had a distinct smell.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the propylic properties of the substance.
meanings.sent3: The propylic solution bubbled like a fizzy drink.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as refreshing as a propylic breeze.
meanings.sent5: The propylic color of the liquid was a vibrant red.

meanings.sent1: The propylic molecule was carefully analyzed under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The propylic structure of the compound was crucial for its stability.
meanings.sent3: The propylic bond held the atoms together like a tiny glue.
meanings.sent4: His words were as strong and stable as a propylic foundation.
meanings.sent5: The propylic shape of the crystal was mesmerizing under the light.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being a propyl alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The propylic solution was used in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The propylic odor of the alcohol lingered in the room.
meanings.sent3: The propylic drink was so strong it made her laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His voice was as smooth as a sip of propylic alcohol.
meanings.sent5: The propylic taste of the beverage was surprisingly pleasant.
